definition: lit. the emperor's daughter does not worry about whether she will be able to marry (idiom)/fig. highly sought after

definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
rare commodity worth hoarding/object for profiteering
to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
the monk coming from afar is good at reading scriptures (idiom)/foreign talent is valued higher than local talent

definition: the rarer sth is, the greater its value (idiom)

definition: if you marry a chicken follow the chicken, if you marry a dog follow the dog (idiom)
pinyin: jia4 ji1 sui2 ji1 , jia4 gou3 sui2 gou3

definition: when radishes are selling fast, one doesn't take the time to wash the soil off them (idiom)/fig. when business is booming, merchants tend to offer goods of inferior quality

definition: the pavilion closest to the water enjoys moonlight first (idiom)/to benefit from intimacy with an influential person

definition: The higher ups have policies while the lower downs have their own ways of getting around them. (idiom)

definition: lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
